A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: As a die hard Star Wars fan I was so excited to see this movie and the new direction they were going for. Turns out the new direction is not a direction at all. Technically well done\, on second thought this movie is a giant mess. It's dumb\, uninspired and nothing really important ever happens. But that's not all. Rian Johnson is succeeding in retroactively making Episode 7 bad too by dropping everything interesting and strengthening the aspects that made TFA problematic - like Rey's Mary Sue-ism. He also destroys any spiritual depth the old trilogy had by declaring the Jedi religion redundant\, but gives us some stupid SJW bullshit instead. I love strong women\, but the ladies in this movie are making the stupidest decisions possible. Did I mention plot holes? It's actually one giant plot hole\, although I'm not sure if it can be called a hole if there's no substance around it in the first place. But the worst thing are probably the morals they are trying to force-feed the viewer: Don't eat meat. Treat animals well. Yes\, that is as deep as it gets in this mess of a movie! Thanks to Disney\, I'm done with Star Wars.
